intro: Noccaea rivalis, commonly known as the common rock白菜, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has basal leaves that are lobed or pinnately divided, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes. It produces small, spherical fruits called siliques, which contain several seeds. Noccaea rivalis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
